reviewText: The new breeds of celebrity are completely lost to the concept of "Less is More."Do any of you know who Cary Grant was?  Handsome, debonair, classy, sophisticated, talented.  And the reason Cary Grant is still thought of as all those things was...he wouldn't show his face in public unless he was Cary Grant.Look at Elvis Presley.  Elvis was so reclusive that when he did appear as a grotesquely overweight and incoherent version of himself, nobody really saw it.  They still saw the "image" of Elvis until well after he died--and some people still don't see anything less!So now you have Britney & Kevin.  Britney is a big pop princess, a jailbait songstress, a sex symbol to young and old.  She marries a lump, a wannabe rapper who abandons his kids and for whatever baffling and mysterious reasons believes he has something to offer the world.  Fine.  The world has survived (so far) Yoko Ono...but, Britney, YOU DON'T VIDEOTAPE the most embarrassing parts of your life and expect the fans to adoringly lap it up.Less is more.
summary: The Stupidest People in the World

reviewText: People that haven't even seen this show shouldn't review it.  Sure, it's a little uncanny from the typical reality TV shows, but are shows like Newlyweds and Big Brother really reality?  Not really, they're glossed-up versions.  Britney's short-lived UPN (honestly, that's a major reason the show didn't do so awesome) Chaotic series, taken mostly by her personal camcorder, is more reality than almost any other reality show has been; it's real, upfront and honest, not glistened by production editing teams that includes background music and crazy psychotic special effects.  Sure, I don't think this show thing was that good of an idea (you are above reality TV, Britney), but "Someday (I Will Understand)" makes this package worth the money as it is Britney's best song if you ask me (she even wrote it herself, like "Everytime" - only this is MUCH more listenable).  Like her or not, Britney Spears' power to persuade (even negative attention as with Chaotic) makes her a true musical force to be reckoned with.
summary: Unbiased review by a Brit fan

reviewText: I've always thought Britney Spears had a great bod and great tunes since she hit the charts in 1998.  But I never thought much of her personal life post-2003's In the Zone because after the too publicized breakup with first love Justin Timberlake (my opinion, her PERFECT match) her girl next door persona dropped increasingly.  I never saw her UPN show Chaotic during its initial TV showing, but I had a feeling it'd end up being a blatant marketing attempt (since 2003's MTV Newlyweds starring Jessica Simpson and then-hubby Nick Lachey proved reality TV could be a great factor for publicity).  But I finally saw Chaotic and realized it was much more personal than most reality shows are, even though the amount of footage of Spears smoking and talking about sex really showcased an entirely new side opposite of the typically seen sexy "Toxic" Britney.  Sure, it's chaotic in a shouldn't-have-been-done-in-the-first-place kind of way, but the show did have its moments.  One thing, though: STOP SMOKING!!

Her bland personality and complete naiivity and idiotic behavior makes itself evident in this show that isn't even bareable for a minute...I'd rather drag myself through Glitter, or Madonna's latest Tour Doc than sit through a single episode of IDIOTIC.I'm not a Jessica Simpson fan really.. reviewText: Well, you would think a DVD of this sort defeats the purpose of bashing it. Truth be told, yes, it IS awful and trashy, but its also very, very interesting.There are six episodes here, each about twenty minutes long. It chronicles how Britney met Kevin and the entire Onyx Hotel European Tour. Personally I think that was Britney's worst tour and the footage doesn't do her any favors - she had already gained some weight here, and this was before she had any kids. Whats worse, is watching Britney and Kevin laze around in tank tops and spout such intelligence such as : "I'm scared to love you, because you're scared to love me... and that makes me scared to love you". More such riches follow, with Kevin making a video tape all his own for Britney where he breaks down and whimpers : "Britney, if you watch this, I want you to know I care. I really care".If that sort of thing is your bag, then by all means get this. I found it tacky, weird, but very, very illuminating. The reason why Britney Spears is such a trainwreck is revealed here, and the answer is that she surrounds herself with retards/psychos/users who are extremely unintelligent and ill-spoken. Her 'personal assistant' Felicia is an unattractive and clueless woman who spends hours speaking of her 'loneliness' and her 'favorite sexual position'. As if this wasn't bad enough, we have the token gay hairdresser giving us his enlightened views on commitment and marriage (?). I kid you not. Then we have Britney and Kevin following each other with cameras trying to get romantic reactions from each other. There is a bizarre green-light shot of the two sharing their first kiss, and it is even more unsightly than the Paris Hilton tape.The series ends with the extremely classless wedding. Kevin lounges about in his overalls while Britney wears her wedding dress. Her parents haven't been told about the wedding and you can see their displeasure when they are brought to the venue and the news is broken to them. We are introduced to Kevin's friends - a useless duo of everything that is wrong with Eminem times twelve. Then Britney's younger sister comes in and starts crying, and the two take their vows.The bonus features, if we must, is a 'Making Of' for Britney's flop single "Someday I Will Understand" (a really bad song, by the way). The video is included too, as well as the video for "Do Something". Jive Records also decided to add on a CD here featuring the Series Theme Song "Chaotic" (not as bad as you'd think), and the sickly "Mona Lisa". I can see why they had the good sense not to include this on a regular Britney release.I actually bought this DVD, because there have been times Britney has entertained me, and I thought her new album "Blackout" was spectacular due to just one standout track ("Heaven on Earth"). However, watching this made me lose whatever remaining respect I had for her. This was perhaps the first time I had seen her without makeup and she was so plain and unattractive that I was left wondering what the big deal was anyway. Not to mention the extra weight, the potty mouth, and her constant smoking on camera (there is nothing more ugly).Britney doesn't need to give you more reasons to dislike her, but all bias apart, this DVD is a fascinating slice of her life, as its completely shot by her and Kevin, and it reveals to you why she is now the jaded, mentally unstable person she is. If that sort of thing would be interesting to you, this is worth a rental.If you're thinking of getting this just for the bonus CD, my advice would be to skip it. There is nothing there that would merit a purchase.
summary: The Best Part : This is 3 Hours Long

reviewText: In some ways, I understand this completely.  When you have just met someone, and you're in the throws of infatuation, you want nothing but to declare how much you love the person no matter how great a catch or how big a loser they may be.  You stare at each other, hold hands, kiss, hug, etc., and you don't mind who sees it.  And, you usually make more than one person sick and you loose a friend or two over it.  Britney, however, didn't just loose a friend or two but lost a whole lot more.This is a snapshot of Britney and Kevin's love in the beginning.  Like a reviewer said here in this forum, it's like that Dave Chappelle stetch "When Keeping It Real Goes Too Far".  They want to show us how much they love each other (or at least how much Britney loved K Fed in the beginning), and even though they're celebrities they are just like us.  The problem is that our everyday lives are just as boring as theirs are, and it's not entertaining to hear the mundane conversations and see just how trashy they are.The night vision and bad dialogue are meant to be funny, but they come off as things only they would find funny.  Now, they are no more, and Britney's apparently clean and sober.  Good for her, I guess.  Bet she's pretty embarassed by this now.

reviewText: I don't understand why "Chaotic" got so much negative attention from the media.  This is the most honest reality TV show you will ever see. Britney and Kevin share some of their most private moments with the public and keep you laughing non-stop. Whether it's Brintey sliding over a table or singing out of the window to random people - you will be entertained. The season finale (Veil of Secrecy) even displays all the details of Brintey's 2004 wedding.In addition to the episodes, there are plenty of bonus features, such as music videos, behind the scenes, additional footage and a bonus CD with three brand new songs including the show's lead song "Chaotic" and Britney's ballad "Someday(I will understand)".This is perfect for a rainy day when you're feeling down.Give it a chance!

reviewText: I consider myself a true fan of Britney Spears. I have all her albums, DVDs, many singles and really support her career, since the very first time I watched "Baby one more time" video, on MTV, back in 1999. Maybe that's the reason why I was shocked when I watched "Chaotic" on UPN. Even though Britney was involved in a few scandals -- which include the 24 hour marriage with her former friend Jason Alexander, the annulment of it, the secret marriage with Kevin Federline,etc --"Chaotic" is the definitive proof that the age of innocence has come to the end. What we watch on "Chaotic" is a face of Britney no fan would like to see. The reality show reveals the intimacy of Britney and Kevin, in such a way  that really disappointed me. The part where britney asks questions about sex sounds really vulgar and she is exposed to critics and midia in general, which did not forgive her. In the show, Kevin behaves as if he is taking advantage of Britney's fame and I'd rather think this is not true, for Britney's sake, especially after the birth of Sean Preston.Nevertheless, this CD+DVD package is really worthy, if you are a fan of Mrs. Federline. I love the videos of "Someday (I'll understand)" -- which seems to me like Britney's redemption after "Chaotic" -- and of "Do somethin'", which is really fun. The bonus CD is cool, with the unreleased tracks "Monalisa", "Chaotic" and "Someday (I'll understand)". This is the reason why I give it 3 stars.
summary: The face of Britney I'd rather not see

reviewText: This DVD was the reason i signed up with AMAZON, i'm a huge BRITNEY fan and of course when the america release date was announced and there no australian release date scheduled, i signed up and this was the first product i purchased. I wasn't dissappointed. How underrated!!! It's such a good show, the reason there is so many negative reviews on it, is because it wasn't filmed for TV.The footage is from Britney and Kevin's camcorder, they filmed it themselves, for themselves. When television networks offered them a reality show, they said no, most likely thinking they didn't need even more cameras following their every move so instead, they sold the rights to UPN to screen footage they had filmed themselves months before of the pair getting together, falling in love, getting engaged and finally, getting married.So perhaps you should know, the footage is raw, unrehearsed and at times jaw dropping. You won't find "virgin, catholic Britney" here. She's growing up. I have to ask, what's the big deal that she lost her virginity before marriage? Realistically, when you think about it, Britney was a 16 girl sitting in a press interview expecting to answer questions about her debut album, and the interviewers ask her "Have you had sex?", "Are you a virgin?". Of course she said "No, i'm still a virgin". How uncomfortable and intimidated would she have felt? And of course she continued to to say that, if she admitted that she lost her virginity, she would have lost her good girl image and (back then) a lot of young female fans finding inspiration in her. She's not a bad person. Most people who thinks she is a bad person for that, are hypocrites.It's a good show, you get a look inside her personal life (and no, not all the lies in the media) and if you really watch it, you can see what Britney is really like; open, caring, scared and protective.Overall, yes, BRITNEY AND KEVIN: CHAOTIC is a funny, refreshing, realistic reality show. But if you're looking for a replacement for NEWLYWEDS: NICK & JESSICA, then you've come to the wrong place.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I think that Chaotic is a reality show to the truest form.  It's not staged like other reality shows, it's just Britney and Kevin being very candid with each other and that's what makes it so enjoyable because you see them for how they really are.  Before this show I really didn't think much of their relationship, I thought he was a loser, but after seeing this show and the genuine love they actually have for each other it's evident to see that he's not just some guy looking for free money, he really cares about her and loves her and I think that's great.  While people may try and bring them down I have great respect and admiration for the two of them to just do what they want and not care what people say.  Also, the video "Someday I Will Understand" in the finale of the show is probably one of the best videos Britney has ever done, it's very grown up and is a great step in the right direction for Britney to move from being a simple teen star to being a strong woman in the business.
